title: EXECUTED: The Terrible Truth About Jungle Monsters

replies.body: How many died to Scuttle Crab?
Too many.  Too damn many.  Would have pushed all the others off the graph.  We don't talk about it lest is bring bad luck.   There is only one that surpasses him, and that is the river duck.
You mean Dave right?  Yeah idk what riot was thinking making that bastard untargetable...
Nerf Dave, being untargetable is too op.
i think they assumed scuttles gender
definitely upvoting this one

I've died to a player, with a scuttlecrab assist once. Only once.

I had nearly no health, and needed a plant badly. The crab was on top of the last fruit I needed to heal and survive the last ticking of a DoT effect, making it so I could not use it and heal.

Damn you scuttlecrab. Reported for assisting enemy team.
At least one, I hit them over the head with scuttle as Syndra.
I got killed once because scuttle ate my honey fruit
Probably some random Veigar
So many that we just started referring to them as, "Bothans."
Rito Plz! It was the wight, wraith, and golem camps in season 4
You raise a great point. We were thinking of how to incorporate this, but any attempt added a lot of wording to the article of graphs.

I have a question.  the graph of the Most Executed Junglers by Season does not include fiddle.  But yet he is the 2nd AVERAGE NUMBER OF EXECUTES PER GAME.  Is he just not in the graph the other seasons?  Bias of fiddle? Or nerf the crap out of him so now he dies with his main source of damage has a heal on it?

As an ex-fiddle main I ask and ask and ask about him but nothing was really done.  Here we are in the jungle were some bruisers can go one or two damage items and the rest tank to 2 or 3 shot him.  His fear can't stop CC because of how the coding works with animation.  Now back to the question at hand.  Was he just forgot about in the graphic or had gotten worst?

Fiddle hasn't seen high execution rates until recently. He's a traditional jungler that doesn't handle raptors well... further because he channels for much of his dmg he can't really kite camps as fast as raptors once he gets in trouble. If he was included in the "over time' graph, it would just be a low straight line until this season.

You can think of the "over time" graph as the highest average execution rates.
Only the most boosted of animals succumb to the wrath of Gromp. savage. {{sticker:zombie-nunu-tears}}
RIP Dyrus

> Nidalee players are suicidal chimpanzees, and if you die to a jungle monster as Ivern you're basically a rounding error.

That's fucking savage, Riot.
Raptors should get a buff if they execute someone.
reporting raptors for help feeding.

Holy crap, these pictures are so cute!
Especially the Rift Scuttle
Scuttle with blood on her hands.  How Rito?  She's innocent I tell you: innocent!
It is just some red honey fruit. Dont worry
What about all those thresh hooks she blocked?
Or the honey fruits she steals?
Yeah!  I don't think those Honey fruit bushes think she's innocent!
Oh hey. That's my Sion video linked in the post :D Thanks Riot <3
lol you're welcome babe. Me and Nancymon made a mental note of how many views you had before so we could see what kind of boost we gave ya. I think it was like 5,000?
{{champion:427}} WHAT THE F@*#k!!!!
How dare you imply that Ivern has a potty mouth.
Fork isn't a bad word.
how does ivern get executed
If somebody else hits the camp then leaves while they keep hitting Ivern I believe.
You should get an award if you get executed as Ivern
Adding 2 more wraiths to the camp didn't help in the least bit, now its not worth to take that camp and I'd rather just go straight into red/krugs.

I'm not a designer, but I do jungle. If the other team is trying to play with a greedy jungler (think twitch), I know they probably won't be taking raptor early. Before it was much easier for a jungler like twitch to just take any random path which, to me, didn't give appropriate risk of picking a jungler that weak early.

It also gives better tradeoffs to counterjungling the easiest camp to take positionally. 

Most traditional junglers are doing fine handling raptors, with the noteable exception of Nidalee, but her clear speed once she gets going can make up for the tradeoff. Edit: Fiddle also, hmm.

The raptor camp is really the most punishing camp for any non-junglers trying to learn the jungle. When I get stuck with jungle (my least played position) due to filling or whatever I avoid the raptors early and mid game because I just don't know how to take them down effectively. At least the krugs are effective in teaching you whether you can go an aoe route or a single target route.
A tip for killing raptors, kill the little ones first to lower the damage output, and smite the big one for a heal to negate their dmg.
yah the raptors are so annoying because it takes so long to kill them and each does about 20 damage i ussualy lose about 75% of my hp if i try to take them on my first clear if i do try
I wonder if this was intentional because they also increased gromp' damage at the start yet it isn't killing any people.

In order to actually execute someone, they have to be sort of surprised, otherwise they'd just run away or not try the camp at all. Gromp has really slow attack speed and readjustment time. So gromp is still not easy to take for many champions, it just doesn't execute that often.

"Only the most boosted of animals succumb to the wrath of Gromp."
I'm dead lmao

"Nidalee players are suicidal chimpanzees,"

LMAO
I love stats like these! This and the Season Review was really interesting.
If Raptors are nearly twice as likely to kill you than Baron, shouldn't *they* be the ones with the buff for killing them?
Someone's job is to draw these adorable flat color drawings ? #Dreamjob
How the heck do you get executed by jungle monsters as Ivern?

From the article: "Ivern is dead last on the chart—the only way he can get executed by a jungle camp is if someone else in the game somehow activates them. The Green Father only gets executed by jungle monsters in one out of every 2,000 games. So, there you have it!"
How can {{champion:62}}  be a jungler and a non-jungler?
He can jungle and go top lane, both roles are common
